featured.text: Our bodies have evolved to exist within Earth’s gravity (1 g), not in the weightlessness of space (0 g) or the microgravity of Mars (0.3 g).
However, with the absence of gravity in the outer space, our body fluids 18 , shifting toward the upper body and the head.
In the earlier days of space travel, scientists tried to overcome the force of gravity so that a rocket could shoot 16 Earth’s pull in order to land humans on the moon.
Today, they are more interested in how reduced gravity affects the astronauts’ 17 condition.
When on Earth, we have more fluids in our lower body because they are pulled down by Earth’s gravity.

definition.zh_def: 重力：使物體相互吸引的自然力，特別是地球對物體的吸引力。
definition.en_def: Gravity: The natural force that attracts two bodies toward each other, especially the attraction of the Earth for objects.
definition.example: The apple fell from the tree due to gravity.
